comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content: The picture shows actually a L.F.G - Roland D.VI fighter. Where L.F.G. stood for Luft Fahrzeug Gesellschaft and Roland was actually the trade name. On this picture the characteristic construction can be seen of the fuselage as patented by L.F.G. This way of building was known in German as a Klinkerrumpf construction, a clinker fuselage.
